summary: This is an email chain between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) and a colleague regarding scheduling meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation. The AUSA invites the colleague to attend an interview on Tuesday and another on Friday concerning an inmate.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, inviting a colleague to interviews related to the Epstein investigation and providing their office contact information.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Interview
events.description: An interview relating to the Epstein investigation scheduled for 12:30 PM.

events.title: Inmate Interview for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Another interview of an inmate relating to the Epstein investigation scheduled for 12:00 PM.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated September 10, 2019, discussing scheduling for the Epstein investigation.
An Assistant United States Attorney is coordinating interviews, including one specifically regarding an inmate, as part of the investigation.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative activity by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in September 2019.
The recipient of the email is a colleague who has not yet received their PIV (Personal Identity Verification) card, suggesting they are a new or visiting staff member.
The document reference 'EFTA00039983' and 'EFTA00039984' appears to be internal file identifiers for the correspondence.
